intro: Duguetia trichostemon, commonly known as the red-flowered bignay, is a member of the Anacardiaceae family. It is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the spring. Following flowering, it produces small, round fruits that turn red when mature. The tree is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been introduced to other tropical areas for horticultural purposes.
